name: FILM 222
title: Critical Methodologies in Film and Television
description: Introduces graduate students to critical methodologies in media studies and offers sustained examination of theoretical approaches to media studies. Methodologies may include (but are not limited to) contemporary theory (semiotic, psychoanalytic, ideological), cultural studies, intertextuality, feminist film, and television theory.
class_notes: Preparation course for Ph.D. qualifying exams. Will support doctoral students who are in their exam year as well as those who are entering year 2 and working on their directed readings in preparation for qualifying exams the following year. Students will focus on writing annotations and/or sample short synthesis papers based on their evolving bibliographies, methods and strategies for synthesis of art practice and text, plus support for improving writing skills.
